tasks.title: Pick Venue
tasks.description: Contact potential venues and see if they'll host your hackathon!

tasks.title: Make Sponsorship Packet
tasks.description: Why should companies sponsor your event

tasks.title: Make List of Potential Sponsors
tasks.description: Find out which companies would be interested in your hackathon

tasks.title: Assign Sponsors to Sponsorship Team
tasks.description: Split up the work needed to be done for sponsorship

tasks.title: Make Email Template to Initiate Relationship
tasks.description: Draft an email to send out to every sponsor with your sponsorship packet attached

tasks.title: Pick Theme for Hackathon (Optional)
tasks.description: Make your hackathon look unique!!

tasks.title: Choose Color Palette
tasks.description: The design of your hackathon should stick to one color palette

tasks.title: Send First Wave of Sponsor Emails
tasks.description: It's the big moment. Convince companies that your event is worth it

tasks.title: Make Website
tasks.description: Give people something pretty to look at when searching for your event

tasks.title: Debug Website
tasks.description: Make sure your website works 200%

tasks.title: Setup Meeting with Venue
tasks.description: Discuss the general logistics of your hackathon with your venue

tasks.title: Design T-Shirt
tasks.description: Get creative with your design and try to make people want to wear it way after your hackathon

tasks.title: Find Apparel Company to Sponsor T-Shirts
tasks.description: Try to find a compnay that will knock a few dollars off of your swag

tasks.title: Template Acceptance and Rejection Emails
tasks.description: You need a way to let people know they got in (or didn't) to your hackathon

tasks.title: Template Application Completion Email (Optional)
tasks.description: You need a way to let people know they finished their application

tasks.title: Open Applications Up to the Public
tasks.description: Cross your fingers and hope there are no bugs

tasks.title: Create Application
tasks.description: Make a place on your website where people can tell you they're coming

tasks.title: Debug Application
tasks.description: Make sure no data gets lost in the application process

tasks.title: Send Second Wave of Sponsor Emails/Follow-Ups
Design Logo
tasks.description: Your hackathon is a brand and every brand needs a logo

tasks.title: Create Handouts for Publicity
tasks.description: Physical promotion is very effective

tasks.title: Find Networking Events to Solicite at
tasks.description: Look on your school's website for career fairs or other various networking events to attend

tasks.title: Assign Someone to Handle Travel Reimbursement
tasks.description: Travel reimbursement is a whole job in itself

tasks.title: Sign Up to be an MLH Event (Optional)
tasks.description: MLH is a great resource to use and to have by your side

tasks.title: Contact School to Get School-Wide Publicity
tasks.description: Getting advertised by your school is the best form of promotion

tasks.title: Find Possible Mailing Lists to be Promoted
tasks.description: A lot of organizations like the idea of hackathons and will promote your event in their organizations

tasks.title: Announce Registration Date
tasks.description: People need to know when to sign up for your hackathon

tasks.title: Plan Meals
tasks.description: Your hackathon needs a menu!

tasks.title: Talk to Food Vendors to Get a Price Check
tasks.description: Do some research to see that you're not getting ripped off. Look for local companies

tasks.title: Pre-Order All Food
tasks.description: Most restaurants requires you to pay for food if they're catering

tasks.title: Design Extra Swag
tasks.description: If you want to offer extra swag to people on the day of

tasks.title: Order All Swag
tasks.description: Find websites to order swag at and compare prices between them

tasks.title: Send Out Acceptance/Rejection Emails
tasks.description: Judge, jury, and executioner

tasks.title: Create Signs for Hackathon
tasks.description: Your attendees need to know where to go during your event

tasks.title: Create Mentor Sign Up Form
tasks.description: Form with: Times available, areas of expertise, company, name, form of contact

tasks.title: Create Workshop Sign Up Form
tasks.description: Form with: name, company, form of contact, time available, topic

tasks.title: Create Judging Sign Up Form (Or you can make it one form)
tasks.description: Form with: name, company, form of contact, areas of expertise

tasks.title: Create Official Schedule
tasks.description: People need to know what's going on during your hackathon

tasks.title: Send Mentor/Workshop/Judging Forms to Companies & Faculty
tasks.description: Find out of if professionals want to do any of these events

tasks.title: Send Another Wave of Sponsor Emails/Follow-Ups
tasks.description: Keep selling your hackathon and raking in money

tasks.description: Keep selling your hackathon and raking in money

tasks.title: Template Day-Of Email
tasks.description: People are going to need information on what to expect when they get to your hackathon

tasks.title: Send Out Day-Of Emails
tasks.description: Give em what they need

tasks.title: Create Shopping List of Snacks/Drinks for Event
tasks.description: Your attendees need a loooooot of snacks to keep them alive for the entirity of your hackathon

tasks.title: Figure Out a Location to Store Snacks/Drinks
tasks.description: You are going to need a big enough room to hold this until your hackathon

tasks.title: Bring team of People to Buy Snacks/Drinks
tasks.description: You are going to need at least 5 people to get everything you need efficiently

tasks.title: Advertise That You Need Volunteers for Event
tasks.description: You are going to need a big team of people to help with day-of events

tasks.title: Create Volunteer Schedule
tasks.description: Develop a schedule with shifts to man all stations during hackathon

tasks.title: Contact Alumni
tasks.description: Alumni of the same field like to support events that are beneficial to their previous program

tasks.title: Make a Plan for Environmental Awareness (Optional)
tasks.description: Some schools give more support to events that are eco-friendly because it makes the school look really good
